author: Nathaniel Taplin
title: Glencore Rewards Those Who Wait - WSJ
text:
Mining is a long-term game—sometimes it pays to just sit tight and let a company dig itself out of a hole.
Mining and commodity-trading heavyweight Glencore proved that on Wednesday, more than quadrupling full-year net income to $5.8 billion and announcing a dividend of $0.20 a share—for a yield of 3.7%. That isn’t bad for a company that a little over two years ago was facing down short sellers as commodity prices plummeted.
